purpose: Provide tools for poker hand evaluation and facilitate the development of poker agents with self-learning capabilities.
principle: Utilizes Rust for efficient hand ranking and starting card enumeration, and provides an arena for agent training using Counterfactual Regret Minimization (CFR).
reusability: Offers a modular Rust library that can be integrated into other Rust projects, with features for hand evaluation and agent training.
limitations: Primarily focused on Texas Hold'em poker, may require additional customization for other poker variants.
name: rs-poker
description: rs-poker is a rust library that includes all of the poker evaluation tools that you need from hand ranking and starting card enumeration to a full agent arena for self learning.
highlight: Comprehensive Rust library for poker evaluation and self-learning agent arena.
